headline: 14 Super Bowl Coin Tosses
text: Many sporting events begin with a coin toss, where the winning team usually makes the choice for who handles the ball at the beginning of the game. At the beginning of the Superbowl, there is a coin toss where the winning team decides whether they will kick or receive the ball. Interestingly, the National Football Conference's winning streak for this coin toss was an amazing 14 years in a row. How likely is that? How many years will we have to wait before there is another 14-year winning streak for this particular coin toss?
